jobDescription: Requirements: A Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Human Resources or related discipline is required. Professional certification such as SPHR, PHR or advanced degree is a plus. Equivalent experience may be accepted. A minimum of 10 years of directly related experience is required. Previous experience working in the pharmaceutical, biotechnology or medical device industry is preferred. Previous experience designing global compensation plans and experience designing and implementing compensation surveys highly preferred. Previous exposure to executive compensation programs a plus. Intermediate or expert level expertise of MS Excel required. Excellent judgment and analytical skills. Strong time management and follow-up skills. Effective oral/written communications skills, interacts well with all levels in HR and overall business units. Ability to work in a versatile, fast paced and deadline oriented environment. Very detail oriented and customer service focused. Familiarity with global compensation strategies, understanding regional pay differences.  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.  Nektar Therapeutics will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in the manner proscribed by the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
